title: Applicability of the Income-tax Act, 2025 from May 2027 CA Exams Onwards
content:
# Applicability of the Income-tax Act, 2025 from May 2027 CA Exams Onwards

The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has officially announced that the Income-tax Act, 2025 will be applicable for CA examinations starting from May 2027. This new legislation received Presidential assent on August 21, 2025, and is scheduled to come into effect from April 1, 2026, governing the tax year 2026-27.

Key details for students:
*   **Effective Date:** The Income-tax Act, 2025 will be examined in CA tests held after March 31, 2027, as the tax year 2026-27 concludes on this date.
*   **Intermediate Level:** Students appearing for Paper 3A: Income-tax Law from the May 2027 cycle onwards will be assessed under the new Act.
*   **Final Level:** The entire tax component in Paper 4: Direct Tax Laws & International Taxation will adopt the new Act starting with the May 2027 examinations.
*   **Self-Paced Online Modules:** Candidates undertaking Self-Paced Online Module Set C - Paper 5: International Taxation on or after May 1, 2027, must also apply the provisions of the updated Income-tax Act.

ICAI has aligned the exam syllabus with this new legislative framework to ensure students are assessed on the most recent tax laws. Students are advised to incorporate these changes into their academic planning and preparation.
